bug.author: nanma56
bug.summary: OpenPose build issue -- "unresolved external symbol "void __cdecl op::wrapperConfigureSecurityChecks(struct op::WrapperStructPose const &,struct op::WrapperStructFace const &,struct op::WrapperStructHand const &,struct op::WrapperStructInput const &,struct op::WrapperStructOutput const &,bool,bool,enum op::ThreadManagerMode)"
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h3>Posting rules</denchmark-h>
Fill the Your System Configuration section (all of it!) if you have some kind of error or performance question. No questions about training. OpenPose only implements testing. No questions about Caffe installation errors/issues. Check Caffe documentation and help for those errors. No questions about CUDA check failed errors. These errors are usually fixed by re-installing CUDA, re-installing the proper cuDNN version, and re-compiling (or re-installing) OpenPose. Otherwise, check for help in CUDA forums. No duplicated posts. No posts about questions already answered / clearly explained in the documentation (e.g. no more low-speed nor out-of-memory questions). Set a proper issue title: add the Ubuntu/Windows word and be specific (e.g. do not simple call it: Compile error). Only English comments. Issues/comments which do not follow these rules will be ignored or removed with no further clarification.
<denchmark-h:h3>Issue Summary</denchmark-h>
With the latest openpose code, without 3D, there are some linkage issues <denchmark-h:h3>Executed Command (if any)</denchmark-h>
Note: add --logging_level 0 --disable_multi_thread to get higher debug information. <denchmark-h:h3>OpenPose Output (if any)</denchmark-h>
Severity Code Description Project File Line Suppression State Error LNK2019 unresolved external symbol "void __cdecl op::wrapperConfigureSecurityChecks(struct op::WrapperStructPose const &,struct op::WrapperStructFace const &,struct op::WrapperStructHand const &,struct op::WrapperStructInput const &,struct op::WrapperStructOutput const &,bool,bool,enum op::ThreadManagerMode)" 3_user_asynchronous C:\openpose_git\openpose\build\examples\tutorial_wrapper\3_user_asynchronous.obj 1 <denchmark-h:h3>Type of Issue</denchmark-h>
You might select multiple topics, delete the rest:
Compilation/installation error
<denchmark-h:h3>Your System Configuration</denchmark-h>
Operating system (lsb_release -a in Ubuntu): Windows 10 Installation mode: VS2015, CMake, CUDA version (cat /usr/local/cuda/version.txt in most cases): CUDA 8.0 cuDNN version: 5.1 Release or Debug mode? (by defualt: release): Release 3-D Reconstruction module added? (by default: no): No GPU model (nvidia-smi in Ubuntu): 1080 Ti Caffe version: Default from OpenPose OpenCV version: pre-compiled 3.3.1 Compiler (gcc --version in Ubuntu): MS V140

comments.comment: Try deleting the cache of CMake, the file is there.

I did a little debugging, so far, on the latest Openpose code the following components builds ok on WIndows 10 + CUDA 8 + CUDNN 5.1 + VS2015
Openpose lib
OpenPose demo
examples->tutorial->pose
examples->tutorial->thread The ones failed on windows:
Examples->Tutorial-> add modules
Examples->Tutorial->Wrapper
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/gineshidalgo99>@gineshidalgo99</denchmark-link> Thank you for the comment. I deleted the CMakelist.txt but the problem persists

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/nanma56>@nanma56</denchmark-link> Fixed in the latest commit. Your feed-back telling me where it fails was super useful (as I was compiling only the demo and I couldn't see any error)

Beautiful. Thank you for your help.
